title: Requires access aisles of handicapped accessible parking spaces to be at least eight feet wide
summary: Requires access aisles of handicapped accessible parking spaces to be at least eight feet wide.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3363

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 25, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. LAVINE, BENEDETTO, CUSICK, KAVANAGH, LATIMER,
         PAULIN, TITUS -- Multi-Sponsored by --  M.  of  A.  AMEDORE,  BARCLAY,
         BOYLAND,  BOYLE,  CLARK,  COLTON, CORWIN, DUPREY, FITZPATRICK, GIGLIO,
         GLICK, GOTTFRIED, HAWLEY, JORDAN, KOLB,  LIFTON,  LUPARDO,  MAYERSOHN,
         McDONOUGH,   J. MILLER,   MOLINARO,   OAKS,  PEOPLES-STOKES,  PHEFFER,
         RABBITT, RAIA, REILICH, J. RIVERA, ROSENTHAL, TEDISCO, THIELE,  TOBAC-
         CO,  TOWNS,  WEISENBERG  -- read once and referred to the Committee on
         Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in  relation  to  providing
         that access aisles of handicapped accessible parking spaces have to be
         at least eight feet wide

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph (b) of subdivision 2 of  section  1203-c  of  the
    2  vehicle  and traffic law, as amended by chapter 207 of the laws of 2010,
    3  is amended to read as follows:
    4    (b) Whenever a person, firm or corporation creates an off-street park-
    5  ing lot or parking garage, or repaves or repaints more than one-half  of
    6  the total number of parking spaces in an off-street parking lot or park-
    7  ing  garage,  which  contains  designated handicapped parking spaces, or
    8  creates designated handicapped parking spaces in an  off-street  parking
    9  lot  or parking garage, or repaves or repaints more than one-half of the
   10  total number of designated handicapped parking spaces in  an  off-street
   11  parking lot or parking garage, [specifications as to] the size of desig-
   12  nated  handicapped  parking  spaces  and  designated handicapped parking
   13  space access aisles EACH shall be [in accordance with  the  requirements
   14  of  the  New  York  state  uniform fire prevention and building code] AT
   15  LEAST EIGHT FEET WIDE. Such access aisles  also  shall  be  (i)  clearly
   16  designated  with conspicuous and permanently installed above grade signs
   17  which shall read "No Parking Anytime" and which shall be positioned from

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06978-01-1

       A. 3363                             2

    1  the access aisle surface at a height of not less than five feet nor more
    2  than seven feet, and (ii) marked with diagonal stripes.
    3    S  2.  This  act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall
    4  have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to providing that access aisles of handicapped accessible parking spaces have to be at least eight feet wide
